title: prevent clang-tidy warnings in user code!
body:
```c++
example/example.cpp|165 col 5| warning: do not implicitly decay an array into a pointer; consider using gsl::array_view or an explicit cast instead [cppcoreguidelines-pro-bounds-array-to-pointer-decay]
||     SPDLOG_TRACE("Some trace message.. {} ,{}", 1, 3.23);
||     ^
/Users/clausklein/Workspace/cpp/spdlog/include/spdlog/spdlog.h|292 col 27| note: expanded from macro 'SPDLOG_TRACE'
|| #define SPDLOG_TRACE(...) SPDLOG_LOGGER_TRACE(spdlog::default_logger_raw(), __VA_ARGS__)
||                           ^
/Users/clausklein/Workspace/cpp/spdlog/include/spdlog/spdlog.h|291 col 42| note: expanded from macro 'SPDLOG_LOGGER_TRACE'
|| #define SPDLOG_LOGGER_TRACE(logger, ...) SPDLOG_LOGGER_CALL(logger, spdlog::level::trace, __VA_ARGS__)
||                                          ^
/Users/clausklein/Workspace/cpp/spdlog/include/spdlog/spdlog.h|288 col 101| note: expanded from macro 'SPDLOG_LOGGER_CALL'
|| #define SPDLOG_LOGGER_CALL(logger, level, ...) (logger)->log(spdlog::source_loc{__FILE__, __LINE__, SPDLOG_FUNCTION}, level, __VA_ARGS__);
||                                                                                                     ^
/Users/clausklein/Workspace/cpp/spdlog/include/spdlog/common.h|65 col 25| note: expanded from macro 'SPDLOG_FUNCTION'
|| #define SPDLOG_FUNCTION __FUNCTION__
||                         ^
```
